Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 05:37PM rolepaul wrote: From a person in the pharmaceutical industry, but not with either Roche or GSK.  Xeloda and Tykerb are drugs that are starting to make a difference in my wife's health.  I have done a little bit of looking around and understand how they work.  Please make sure that you make your doctor aware of issues that come up with her GI tract and hands/feet.  Internet searches showed that the latter issue can have some help with Henna paste put on soles and palms for Xeloda side effects.  I just started to put this on for my wife and it made a huge difference.  Both of these drugs are new and you want to make sure that an older patient is able to tolerate them.
Posts.Title: Help me Help Mom with Abraxene or Tycerb/Xeloda michelshelpformom rolepaul
